title: Project-Based Physics Problem-Solving Applying Newton's Laws of Motion

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of elementary calculus and classical mechanics
context.additional_context: A project-based program for workers in their 40s and above to apply Newton’s laws of motion to real workplace problems, with peer instruction and feedback to enhance conceptual mastery

learning_goals: Solve at least five physics problems modeling real work environments using Newton’s three laws, achieving over 80% accuracy
Correct at least three misconceptions through collaborative discussions with peers during peer instruction activities
Analyze and present simulation results of motion laws at least three times using digital tools in a BYOD environment

resources: Real-World Case Dataset on Motion Laws

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
